abstract: As shareholders, industry watchers and lawmakers continued to express outrage over the $210 million golden farewell that Home Depot awarded its ousted chief executive, Robert L. Nardelli, The New York Times takes a look at where it all began: General Electric, which has become a kind of high-end boutique where company directors go when they are looking for the cream of the crop in chief executives.
lead_paragraph: As shareholders, industry watchers and lawmakers continued to express outrage over the $210 million golden farewell that Home Depot awarded its ousted chief executive, Robert L. Nardelli, The New York Times takes a look at where it all began: General Electric, which has become a kind of high-end boutique where company directors go when they are looking for the cream of the crop in chief executives.

headline.main: Home Depot Moves Put G.E., Martin Lipton in Spotlight
